com.caffeineowl.googlemaps.automation.pageobjects

Class PageContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caffeineowl.googlemaps.automation.pageobjects.PageContext
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectionsPage, HomePage

    public abstract class PageContext
extends Object

    Abstract class to pack the idea of "encapsulating and protecting the UI elements and exposing only the automation logic".

    Shortcomings:

    1. only a "wrapping" against the WebDriver, with a minimalistic identification of the "context" (by the use of a PageEnum method to designate it).
    2. missing the "site map" concept to handle the navigation between pages. This is on purpose (focus was to explore the specific of "page objects" rather than go full throttle in a limited time), however the "place holder for extensions" (and their need) is signaled by the navigateTo(PageEnum) method.
    The class also provides utility methods for the general techniques of finding UI elements (the protected waitForElementClickable(By, long, String), waitForElementListVisible(By, long, String) instance methods and the static waitForElementClickable(WebDriver, By, long, String) waitForElementListVisible(WebDriver, By, long, String) ones).
    Author:
    acolomitchi

      • navigateTo

        public abstract void navigateTo(PageEnum page)

        This is where a SiteMap class may come handy; I mean… rather than returning void, maybe it's the SiteMap class to handle various pages via a method called attachPage which would automatically checkContextElements()

        But this may be a suboptimal design! Rationale: we are not handling simple pages, but states/transitions here; a proper approach would be to describe the states and possible transitions. Then, ask the test environ to travel all and any edge of the graph for 100% coverage. Eh, one can only dream!
